title: Why won't my site work on Firefox mobile?
content:
I have a blog hosted on Render. The base URL provided by them is https://parker-codes.onrender.com. This URL works perfectly, in all browsers.

I purchased a domain from Google and then linked a CNAME record to the Render one: https://blog.parker-codes.dev. This URL works in many browsers except for Firefox Mobile (on Android). I receive the error "Address not found. The browser could not find the host server for the provided address."

- I flushed the DNS cache and checked that it propagated across the globe. I used nslookup to verify the domain resolution. - I tested in various other browsers on desktop (Safari, Chrome, Firefox) and mobile (Chrome) and they all work. - I turned off mobile extensions. I also tried in a private window. Still no luck. - I reached out to Google support. They don't see any domain or DNS issues on their end.

From all of this, it appears that the Firefox mobile browser has a bug that can't load the site for some reason. It can't properly resolve the host even though many other browsers can.
creator: parker.mcmullin01

title: PDF Names
content:
Soy usuario de varios navegadores. Me agrada FireFox pero prefiero Chrome por la facilidad para manejar los PDF.s A partir de que instale FireFox cuando en una aplicación se debe abrir un PDF ahora lo hace en FireFox. No tendría problema si me diera la misma facilidad que tengo con Chrome. El problema es el siguiente: Se abre el documento PDF en FireFox y por cada PDF abre una pestaña nueva y asi hasta que tengo todos mis PDF en distintas pestañas del fireFox. Procedo a guardar cada archivo PDF con un nombre diferente Lo guarda perfectamente pero en el identificador de la pestaña sigue apareciendo el nombre generico y no es sencillo identificar cuales ya guardé y cuales no. En Chrome cuando guardo el archivo con su nuevo nombre , en la pestaña le cmabia el nombre y si me distraigo por una llamada o porque atendi a alguien cuando regreso me puedo dar cuenta cuales ya guarde y cuales no. ¿Me pueden ayudar ? 

a una de las  siguientes  opciones

a) encontrar como hacer esto en firefox ó b) hacer que firefox sea el determinado para abrir los pdf.

actualmente el navegador predeterminado en Chrome

Saludos y muchas gracias
creator: lasdl

title: Stop URL autocomplete after enter
content:
Hi,

I want to know how to stop URL autocomplete from taking me to a bookmarked we set that happens to have a similar spelling.

For instance, when I type “cat” a list populated with all urls starting with the word “catalog”. I do not want to search for a known url or I would select it from the drop down list. I want to search the word “cat”. I have to enter a blank space to search a single term but this is super annoying when your trying to quickly find content.

How can I adjust this so when I type a word, it will only search that word when I hit enter rather than jump to a saved url.

Thanks Dave

title: Highlighting CSS in Dev Tools
content:

In Firebug, I could click that and the + sign and that same exact code would appear on the right. But it does not. It's some modified version and I always have to update the code.

If there something? Also, in Firebug, I could right click that element at the bottom and copy it. I cannot do that. It doesn't allow me to copy it.

This is really slowing me down and I don't like to use a lot of add-ons in the browsers. Thanks in advance.
